title: refactor(telemetry): use data classes to fix detekt LongParameterList
message:
refactor(telemetry): use data classes to fix detekt LongParameterList

Refactored ValidationTelemetry to use ValidationEvent and ErrorEvent data classes
instead of long parameter lists, satisfying detekt's LongParameterList rule.

Updated Main.kt and ValidationTelemetrySpec.kt to use the new data class APIs.

title: feat(telemetry): add validation telemetry for Play Store checks (T-010)
message:
feat(telemetry): add validation telemetry for Play Store checks (T-010)

Add structured telemetry logging for Play Store validation operations:
- New ValidationTelemetry module with structured log format
- Tracks success/collision/error events with duration metrics
- Includes CI context (job ID, pipeline ID, project path)
- Outputs to stderr in [TELEMETRY] key=value format for log parsing

Changes:
- Add telemetry/ValidationTelemetry.kt with Status enum and logging functions
- Update Main.kt to use telemetry timing and logging
- Add ValidationTelemetrySpec.kt with comprehensive tests
- Mark T-010 as complete in nat3-v2.md

Telemetry output example:
[TELEMETRY] event=play_store_validation status=available package=com.example.app
            version_code=54 duration_ms=1234 timestamp=2025-01-15T10:30:00Z

fix(ci): consolidate release into single 'release' job

See merge request android-team/v3/devops/ci-component!48

title: fix(ci): consolidate release into single 'release' job
message:
fix(ci): consolidate release into single 'release' job

Instead of creating a tag and waiting for a separate tag pipeline to
create the release, now the 'release' job does everything in one step:
1. Calculate next version from conventional commits
2. Create and push the git tag
3. Create GitLab Release via API (publishes to CI/CD Catalog)

Renamed from 'prepare-release' to 'release' since it actually releases,
not just prepares.

This eliminates issues with tag pipelines failing due to component
include resolution problems.

title: Merge branch 'fix/tag-pipeline-include' into 'main'
message:
Merge branch 'fix/tag-pipeline-include' into 'main'

fix(ci): skip component validation for tag pipelines

See merge request android-team/v3/devops/ci-component!47

title: fix(ci): skip component validation for tag pipelines
message:
fix(ci): skip component validation for tag pipelines

The component include with @$CI_COMMIT_SHA fails for tag pipelines
because components aren't accessible by arbitrary commit SHA.

Skip component validation for tags since releases don't need to
validate the component system - that's done during branch/MR pipelines.

title: refactor(ci): use CI_JOB_TOKEN instead of custom token for git push
message:
refactor(ci): use CI_JOB_TOKEN instead of custom token for git push

GitLab 17.2+ supports 'Allow Git push requests to the repository' setting.
This eliminates the need for a separate CI_GIT_PUSH_TOKEN variable.

message: fix(ci): handle non-zero exit code in jar-cli smoke test

title: feat(release): add hybrid release workflow with automatic versioning
message:
feat(release): add hybrid release workflow with automatic versioning

- Add calculate-release-version CLI command to version-util
- Add manual prepare-release job in CI pipeline
- Implement pre-1.0.0 protection (BREAKING CHANGE stays in 0.x)
- Document release workflow in docs/RELEASES.md

The workflow:
1. After merge to main, click 'prepare-release' play button
2. Version is calculated from conventional commits
3. Tag is created and pushed automatically
4. Tag triggers create-release which publishes to CI/CD Catalog

title: chore(ci): improve release job description for catalog
message: chore(ci): improve release job description for catalog

title: refactor(ci): overhaul pipeline for CI/CD component library
message:
refactor(ci): overhaul pipeline for CI/CD component library

This is a CI/CD component library, not an Android app. Updated pipeline:

LINT STAGE:
- lint:ktlint - Kotlin style checking
- lint:detekt - Kotlin static analysis
- lint:yaml - YAML template validation

BUILD STAGE:
- build:jar - Build shadow JAR artifact
- validate:jar-sync - Ensure committed JAR matches Kotlin sources

TEST STAGE:
- test:kotlin - Run 50 unit tests (Spek + JUnit 5)
- test:jar-cli - Smoke test JAR CLI works
- test:component - Validate GitLab CI component system

RELEASE STAGE:
- create-release - Create GitLab release on tag

Also:
- Add GRADLE_OPTS variable for consistent Gradle config
- Use VERSION_UTIL_DIR variable to reduce duplication
- Simplify job names (lint:ktlint vs lint:kotlin:ktlint)
- Add proper JUnit test report artifacts

title: fix(lint): fix yamllint errors across all YAML files
message:
fix(lint): fix yamllint errors across all YAML files

- Disable quoted-strings rule (GitLab CI uses quotes for clarity)
- Remove trailing spaces from all YAML templates and examples
- Fix .yamllint.yml to not require quotes on yaml-files entries

title: fix(templates): add macOS and Linux cross-platform compatibility
message:
fix(templates): add macOS and Linux cross-platform compatibility

- sha256sum/shasum: Use 'command -v' to detect available tool
  - Linux: sha256sum (standard)
  - macOS: shasum -a 256 (fallback)

- sed -i: Use version detection for in-place edit syntax
  - GNU sed (Linux): sed -i 'pattern'
  - BSD sed (macOS): sed -i '' 'pattern'

Supports both Mac Mini runner (macOS) and DigitalOcean droplet (Linux)

title: feat(play-store): add Play Store API collision validation
message:
feat(play-store): add Play Store API collision validation

Implements Play Store API integration to check versionCode collisions before
upload, preventing deployment failures and reducing Google Play review delays.

Features:
- PlayStoreClient: Queries existing versionCodes from all tracks (internal,
  alpha, beta, production)
- PlayStoreCollisionChecker: CollisionChecker implementation using Play Store API
- PlayStoreException: Typed exception hierarchy for API errors (auth, network,
  permissions, quota)
- validate-play-version CLI command: Standalone validation tool for CI pipelines

CLI Usage:
  java -jar scripts/version-util.jar validate-play-version \
    --package-name com.example.app \
    --version-code 54 \
    --service-account-json "$PLAY_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_JSON"

Exit codes:
  0 = Available
  1 = Collision (returns nextAvailable in JSON)
  2 = API error (auth, network, permission)

Fallback strategy:
- With credentials: Queries real Play Store API
- Without credentials: Prints warning, skips validation (local dev mode)

Documentation:
- docs/CI_TOKEN_USAGE.md: Service account setup guide
- docs/TEMPLATE_USAGE.md: CI integration examples
- scripts/version-util/README.md: CLI command reference

Dependencies:
- google-api-services-androidpublisher v3-rev20250602-2.0.0
- google-auth-library-oauth2-http 1.23.0
- google-http-client-gson 1.44.2

Tests:
- PlayStoreCollisionCheckerSpec: Unit tests with stub client
- Validates collision detection, error handling, exception wrapping

title: docs(registry): simplify to CI_JOB_TOKEN only for publishing
message:
docs(registry): simplify to CI_JOB_TOKEN only for publishing

Streamline GitLab Package Registry documentation to focus exclusively
on CI_JOB_TOKEN for publishing workflows.

Changes:
- Remove Deploy Token and Personal Access Token sections for publishing
- Keep CI_JOB_TOKEN as single recommended method
- Add brief note about alternative methods for consumers only
- Reduce from 601 to 457 lines (24% reduction)
- Clarify that Deploy Tokens are for other teams consuming packages

Rationale:
- CI_JOB_TOKEN is zero-config and automatically secure
- Deploy Tokens are for consumers (cloud team, etc.), not publishers
- Simplifies onboarding and reduces confusion
- Matches production CI/CD workflow exactly

title: docs(libraries): add libraries subgroup README
message:
docs(libraries): add libraries subgroup README

Add comprehensive documentation for the libraries/ subgroup covering:
- Repository overview (android-toolbox, kmp-toolbox)
- Quick start for consumers and maintainers
- Publishing workflow and versioning strategy
- GitLab Package Registry configuration
- Migration information from old toolbox
- CI/CD template usage
- Contributing guidelines

This document serves as the main README for the libraries/ subgroup
and provides central documentation for all library repositories.

title: feat(toolbox): implement T-007 dependency-ordered publishing with GitLab Package Registry
message:
feat(toolbox): implement T-007 dependency-ordered publishing with GitLab Package Registry

Implements complete solution for splitting android-toolbox repositories with
Gradle-based dependency ordering and GitLab Package Registry integration.

Key Features:
- Topological sorting algorithm for dependency-ordered publishing
- Automatic module discovery and circular dependency detection
- GitLab Package Registry integration with CI_JOB_TOKEN
- Per-module versioning and tagging
- Dry-run mode for safe testing
- Comprehensive validation tasks

Changes:
- Add scripts/publish-ordered.gradle.kts - Gradle dependency ordering script
  - Implements topological sort for modules
  - Validates dependency order (detects circular deps)
  - Publishes modules in correct order
  - Tasks: publishAllModulesOrdered, validateDependencyOrder, printDependencyGraph

- Update templates/artifacts/android-toolbox.yml
  - Add dependency-ordered publishing
  - Configure GitLab Package Registry (CI_JOB_TOKEN)
  - Add per-module tagging (toolbox-<module>-v<version>)

- Update templates/artifacts/kmp-toolbox.yml
  - Add dependency-ordered publishing for KMP
  - Configure GitLab Package Registry
  - Add per-module tagging for KMP modules

- Add docs/TOOLBOX_MIGRATION.md (750+ lines)
  - Complete migration guide for DevOps team
  - Architecture and repository structure
  - Implementation steps with code examples
  - Testing guide and troubleshooting

- Add docs/TOOLBOX_MIGRATION_QUICKSTART.md (450+ lines)
  - Quick start guide for library maintainers
  - Step-by-step migration checklist
  - Local testing instructions
  - Best practices

- Add docs/GITLAB_PACKAGE_REGISTRY.md (500+ lines)
  - Complete GitLab Package Registry configuration
  - Three authentication options
  - Gradle publishing configuration
  - Consumer setup and troubleshooting
  - Security best practices

- Add docs/examples/GITLAB_PACKAGE_REGISTRY_EXAMPLE.md (650+ lines)
  - End-to-end working example
  - Complete repository setup
  - Publishing and consuming workflow
  - Real-world code examples

- Update README.md
  - Add GitLab Package Registry references
  - Update toolbox migration documentation links

- Update docs/IMPLEMENTATION_PLAN.md
  - Document T-007 completion
  - Add acceptance criteria checklist
  - Add deployment steps

Acceptance Criteria (T-007):
✅ Two separate repos documented: android-toolbox and android-toolbox-kmp
✅ Gradle task: publishAllModulesOrdered handles dependency order
✅ CI publishes to GitLab Package Registry
✅ Tags created per module: toolbox-network-v1.6.0
✅ Migration guide documents moving modules
✅ Circular dependency detection with fail-fast
✅ Clear error messages with actionable feedback
✅ Dry-run mode supported

GitLab Package Registry:
- Uses CI_JOB_TOKEN for automatic authentication
- Zero manual configuration required
- Project-level and group-level registry support
- Secure token handling (scoped, auto-rotating)

Testing:
- Validated Gradle script logic
- Verified topological sort algorithm
- Tested circular dependency detection
- Validated GitLab Package Registry URL format
- Verified CI template variable defaults

References:
- Task: T-007 (docs/nat3-v2.md line 797)
- Issue: https://gitlab.nweca.com/android-team/devops/ci-component/-/issues/7

BREAKING CHANGE: android-toolbox and android-toolbox-kmp templates now require
proper Gradle publishing configuration in module build files. See migration guide.
